resources.string: "Sync Authenticator\'s internal clock with Google servers"

"If you press "Sync now", Authenticator will attempt to sync its internal clock with Google servers once. The device\'s Date & Time settings will not be changed.

Authenticator does not transmit any personal data or account information while synchronising its internal clock with Google servers.

Why this is useful

Authenticator generates 2-step verification codes based on 1) the current time, and 2) a secret number known to the app and the server.

If Authenticator and the server disagree on what time it is, the codes that the app generates may not be accepted when you try to log in.

By default Authenticator uses the device\'s Date & Time settings, and in most cases you will be able to generate valid codes by making sure your time, date, and time zone settings are configured correctly. However, when time mismatches do occur, they can be hard to troubleshoot (especially if you use network-provided time or time zones)."
"Authenticator\'s internal clock has been adjusted to match the time provided by Google servers. "\n\n"The Date & Time settings on this device have not been changed."
"Authenticator\'s internal clock was not adjusted because it appears to already be in sync with Google servers."
"There was a problem contacting Google\'s server. Please check your network settings and try again."
